recipe.ingredients: - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - onion (chopped): 1 large - carrots (peeled and diced): 2 - celery stalks (diced): 2 - garlic cloves (minced): 2 - zucchini (diced): 1 - low-sodium vegetable broth: 6 cups - diced tomatoes (no salt added): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - frozen green beans: 1 cup - dried thyme: 1/2 teaspoon - dried parsley: 1 teaspoon - salt (optional): to taste - black pepper: to taste
recipe.directions: 1. Heat the Olive Oil: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, carrots, and celery. Saut√© until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes. 2. Add Garlic and Zucchini: Add the minced garlic and diced zucchini to the pot. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. 3. Pour in Broth and Tomatoes: Stir in the low-sodium vegetable broth and can of diced tomatoes. Bring the mixture to a boil. 4. Simmer Soup: Add the frozen green beans, thyme, and parsley. Reduce heat to low and let the soup simmer for about 20 minutes, or until all vegetables are tender. 5. Season: Add salt and black pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning as needed. 6. Serve Warm: Ladle the soup into bowls and serve warm, perfect for a cozy lunch during the colder months.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 20g, Dietary Fiber: 4g, Sodium: 400mg, Saturated Fat: 0g, Total Fat: 3g, Protein: 3g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 8g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 390 calories for the entire pot. - Calories for each ingredient: Olive Oil: 119 calories per tablespoon Onion: 46 calories Carrots: 50 calories Celery: 14 calories Garlic: 9 calories Zucchini: 33 calories Low-Sodium Vegetable Broth: 60 calories for 6 cups Diced Tomatoes: 53 calories per can Green Beans: 34 calories per cup - Serving People: 6
